### 🖋 **Text style**

### 🎨 **Color & contrast**
* Choose calm palettes but maintain WCAG‑compliant contrast (minimum 4.5 : 1 for body text).  
* High‑contrast text on images; test with a grayscale check or free contrast analyzers.  
* Keep bright colors for highlights only; maintain consistent background tone across posts.

### 📷 **Alt‑text / image description**
* Begin with the literal scene (“Soft blue gradient with leaf silhouette”), then note emotional tone (“calm, quiet”).  
* Aim for 1–2 sentences, ≤125 characters if posting in environments that truncate alt‑text.  
* Avoid value judgments (“beautiful,” “soothing”)—describe, don’t prescribe.

### 🔄 **Layout & timing**
* Schedule posts consistently (same hour each day) so rhythm reinforces steadiness.  
* Include any resource lines (988 / findahelpline.com) in pinned or recurring posts.  
* Keep captions and visuals readable on mobile—test 1.4× zoom.

### 🫱🏽‍🫲🏼 **Inclusive tone**
* Use “we” and “us” instead of “you should.”  
* Normalize human experiences (“many people feel restless”) without labeling emotions as disorders.  
* Invite connection, not self‑diagnosis—link to real professional help for anything severe.
